bug.short_desc: regardless of what is visible, all cells are updated - qx.ui.virtual.layer

long_desc.thetext:
Regardless of what is visible, all cells are updated on a qx.ui.virtual.layer when scrolling or calling any of the update methods.
I don't know where it should be implemented, but looking at qx.ui.virtual.layer.WidgetCellSpan qx.ui.virtual.layer.WidgetCell and qx.ui.virtual.layer.Abstract, it appears there is nothing implemented to restrict updating of child objects to what is visible.
It is possible to see this by taking a look at the demo: http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/demobrowser/#virtual~Gallery.html
Quoting qx.ui.virtual.layer.Abstract: * This class queues calls to {@link #fullUpdate}, {@link #updateLayerWindow} * and {@link #updateLayerData} and only performs the absolute necessary * actions. Concrete implementation of this class must at least implement * the {@link #_fullUpdate} method. Additionally the two methods * {@link #_updateLayerWindow} and {@link #_updateLayerData} may be implemented * to increase the performance.
However, neither qx.ui.virtual.layer.WidgetCellSpan qx.ui.virtual.layer.WidgetCell implement such methods. It looks like any of fullUpdate updateLayerWindow, and updateLayerData do the same thing.
I'm guessing that this still needs to be implemented.
